page.title: 13HISTORICAL GHOSTS
page.content: {HISTORICAL GHOSTS. In l652 , Thomas Yarwood, who was a Quaker, was attacked in Knutsford and mortally wounded. He was taken to the house of Richard Yarwood; known as Yarwood House, which was a Quaker Meeting House. One account has it that he died of his wounds there and was buried under a Yew tree in the garden. A second account has it that Thomas died at a later date and was buried in the Quaker Graveyard(GRO379O38l). However the ghost which appears in the garden of Yarwood House is a lady! {ANNE BOLEYN'S GHOST. There is a White Lady who haunts Hill House and Lady Lane near to Yarwood House. One account is that a lady was beheaded with a woodchopping axe in the garden of Hill House, why or by whom is not known. However, another explanation for the haunting in this
